intro: Drypetes usambarica var. usambarica, commonly known as the Usambara drypetes, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Usambara Mountains in Tanzania. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellowish-green, followed by distinctive, fleshy fruits that are orange-red when mature. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along stream banks.
